item.title: Festive Events Make a Return to GTA Online Through January 1, 2025
item.content:encoded:
https://wccftech.com/festive-events-make-a-return-to-gta-online-through-january-1-2025/

Festivities are returning to the streets of Los Santos, and players will get to enjoy the holiday events in GTA Online again. From December 19 through January 1, there are plenty of events to participate in, as well as plenty of rewards to get your hands on. Of course, there is also the most recently added GTA Online: Agents of Sabotage update for you to get stuck into, which adds new decommissioned law enforcement vehicles for you to purchase, as well as a whole new HQ to make yours.

In today's update, there are multiple returning seasonal events for you to dive into. This includes the return of the Gooch, the Weazel Plaza Shootout, and the Yeti Hunt. By participating in these events, you can get some great rewards, such as the Yeti Outfit, the Gooch Outfit, The Snowman Outfit, and much more. Outfits aren't the only things you'll be able to get your hands on, as there is now Double Garment Factory Passive Income and Double Rewards on Pizza Deliveries and Dispatch Work if you feel that you need to make some big bucks to make it through the festive season.

You can also get triple the amount of GTA$ and RP by participating in Entourage (Festive Remix). In addition to that, you can nab rewards such as the Snowman Finish for the Combat Pistol, the Skull Santa Finish for the Special Carbine, and the Santa's Helper Finish for the Heavy Sniper if you complete the challenges set out for you in Entourage.

In the spirit of generosity and giving during the festive season, all GTA Online players will get a free holiday gift. This comes with the Winter Holidays Onesie, Reindeer Necklace, Firework Launchers, Armor, and much more. All of this is completely free and is definitely worth getting your hands on if you're looking to cause havoc on the streets of Los Santos while looking like you're in the festive spirit.

Of course, there is plenty more to dive into for the holiday period in GTA Online, including LS Car Meet Test Rides and Prize Rides, as well as hefty discounts at the Gun Van. Those who are subscribed to GTA+ will also get a free vehicle, outfit, and early access to a brand-new weapon at the Gun Van.

For all of the nitty-gritty details about today's update in GTA Online, you can check out the Rockstar Games Newswire, which tells you everything you need to know about the update.

item.title: Nintendo Switch 2 Dock May Have Been Designed to Let the Console Run Faster, but Will Reportedly Only Output 4K Resolution at 30 FPS
item.content:encoded:
https://wccftech.com/nintendo-switch-2-dock-4k-30-fps-only/

The Nintendo Switch 2 dock may have been designed to let the console run faster, but won't be able to output at smooth framerates at 4K resolution.

A Reddit user by the name of NextHandheld allegedly has had access to the new console by Nintendo and has revealed some additional information on the system as well as on the dock and Joy-Con controller while also providing proof that their information has merit. Such proof, which includes pictures of the system's dock and the inside of a possible controller rail has also been provided to The Verge, which concluded that the leaker may be legit after talking with them as well.

While most of the information revealed by NextHandheld falls in line with other rumors and leaks that have been circulating online in the past few weeks, some of the information on the Nintendo Switch 2 dock, which was never shown in any of the previous leaks, is new. The picture of the dock shown to The Verge shows that it has big feet around the back so that it can be placed horizontally without blocking a potential set of vents. While no one would position the dock this way, these feet may have been placed in case the dock is accidentally knocked over to prevent overheating. And if vents are included in the dock, as the leaker seems to have confirmed, albeit cryptically, then there's a very good chance the console will run faster in docked mode. In addition, the leaker revealed that the dock is rated for 60W, while the Nintendo Switch 2 for 45W, values that are considerably higher than the original model, and that it will only output 4K resolution at 30 frames per second, which would definitely be disappointing if true.

As mentioned above, NextHandheld also revealed plenty of other information on the Nintendo Switch 2. You can find a summary of the information shared by the leaker on the Nintendo Switch 2 subreddit. Despite the proof the leaker has provided, we strongly suggest taking all the new information with a huge grain of salt.

The Nintendo Switch 2 has yet to be officially revealed, but there's been some chatter that its reveal could happen right after the new year begins. No matter when it is revealed and released, the console is projected to be the most successful next-generation system, something that will further solidify Nintendo's position as the console market leader for the next few years.

item.title: Fallout 76 Ghoul Experience Detailed by Bethesda
item.content:encoded:
https://wccftech.com/fallout-76-ghoul-experience-detailed-by-bethesda/

Tomorrow, Bethesda Game Studios will open up the gates of the Fallout 76 PTS (Public Test Server) to allow fans to play as a Ghoul for the first time in the franchise, likely in response to the massive acclaim enjoyed by the TV show's Cooper Howard character played by Walton Goggins.

Meanwhile, they shared a few details with the press. Playing as a Ghoul (with customizable design and even skin texture) is an endgame experience, as the related quest only starts at level 50. Ghouls will have 'dozens of alternate ways' to specialize their character, according to the developers.

To begin with, they are not only immune to radiation; it actually heals them. If your character is hurt, standing on top of some radioactive material will start healing them. Moreover, once fully healed, the excess radiation will build up into a new resource called Glow. Depending on how the player character is specialized, Glow can provide various effects. Ghouls can also utilize 32 exclusive perk cards on top of those already available for human characters, providing great variety when it comes to character progression.

Ghouls do not feel hunger or thirst in Fallout 76. However, they must manage a feral meter instead. If a character turns full feral, they'll suffer from drawbacks like reduced hit points and worse accuracy with weapons, but they'll also get a boost in hand-to-hand combat, potentially unlocking a berserker type of playstyle.

Many NPCs (non-player characters) and factions will interact differently with player ghouls, such as the Brotherhood of Steel, who do not take kindly to ghouls. You won't be blocked from their stories, though; instead, this will reportedly open up new narrative paths to experience. Bethesda also said there will be in-world ways to disguise your being a Ghoul. Last but not least, player Ghouls will have the ability to revert to human form, though you will only be able to do this once for free.

There's no final release date for this update yet, although the developers aim to launch it sometime in early 2025. As a reminder, Fallout 76 was recently updated with a brand new raid experience called Gleaming Depths, an MMO-style endgame dungeon where a party of four players must go through five tough encounters to obtain the new four-star legendary weapons.

item.title: GeForce NOW Adds NieR Games & Zenless Zone Zero To Cloud
item.content:encoded:
https://wccftech.com/geforce-now-adds-nier-games-zenless-zone-zero-to-cloud/

It's time for another GeForce NOW update, and this time, it adds some great action RPGs to get stuck into over the winter period. There are four new games that you can stream from the cloud as long as you are a subscriber to GeForce NOW. These games include Zenless Zone Zero, NieR: Automata, and more. In addition to these games being added to the service, those who are GeForce NOW members will be able to get a virtual stadium front-row seat for the CES opening keynote, which NVIDIA Founder and CEO Jensen Huang will deliver on January 6. For more information, make sure to check out the NVIDIA website, as well as the NVIDIA socials on X.

Now, moving on to the games that have been added. The first one is Zenless Zone Zero, the latest gacha game by miHoYo. This game takes you to a futuristic world called New Eridu and has combat similar to that of Borderlands with a touch of souls-like sprinkled in. If you want to know more about Zenless Zone Zero, check out our review of the game from when it was first released. A major update has just been released for Zenless Zone Zero, adding two new playable characters and the finale of the first story arc in the game.

The other additions to GeForce NOW include the iconic NieR games. This comprises NieR: Automata and NieR Replicant ver.1.22474487139... Both are fantastic games with beefy stories, multiple endings, and a lot of fast-paced combat.

NieR: Automata is a story about the war between androids and machines, and it will keep you on your toes as you have to fight for survival. In this story, you are introduced to androids 2B, 9S, and A2 and get to witness their stories of how they are fighting for survival in a post-apocalyptic world where everything wants to kill them.

NieR Replicant ver.1.22474487139... is a game that follows the story of a devoted brother whose mission is to save his sister while coming across many dark secrets that will challenge humanity and its very existence.

Unrelated to NieR, Replikant Chat has now been added to GeForce NOW. This is an AI game that allows you to speak to all sorts of characters with unique personalities in different environments to suit your needs. It uses multiple AI systems, such as ChatGPT, Google AI, Gemini, and Claude AI.

What will you be playing this holiday season?
